unnormalised: Okay, so someone asked about finding a good PG in Bangalore, and honestly, finding a decent one can be a total headache. I've been there, done that. I moved here from Kolkata for work back in 2022, and the initial search was… well, let's just say I learned a lot.
normalised: Okay, so someone asked about finding a good P-G in Bangalore, and honestly, finding a decent one can be a total headache. I've been there, done that. I moved here from Kolkata for work back in two thousand and twenty two, and the initial search was… well, let's just say I learned a lot.

unnormalised: First off, don't just blindly trust online listings. I saw pictures of "luxury" PGs, only to find out the address, 27th Main Rd, Sector 1, HSR Layout, Bangalore, 560102, led to a building that looked like it hadn't been painted since the 90s. The rooms were tiny, the shared bathroom was... questionable, and the "attached balcony" was basically a glorified window. The rent quoted on the website was Rs. 8000, but suddenly jumped to ₹10,000 after "taxes and maintenance." Classic.
normalised: First off, don't just blindly trust online listings. I saw pictures of "luxury" P-G's, only to find out the address, twenty seventh Main Road, Sector one, H-S-R Layout, Bangalore, five hundred and sixty one hundred and two, led to a building that looked like it hadn't been painted since the nineties. The rooms were tiny, the shared bathroom was... questionable, and the "attached balcony" was basically a glorified window. The rent quoted on the website was rupees eight thousand, but suddenly jumped to rupee ten thousand after "taxes and maintenance." Classic.

unnormalised: Then there was the PG on 80 Feet Road, Koramangala, Pin Code 560034. The address seemed good, right? Prime location. But the reality was different. It was crammed with people, the food was consistently awful (think watery dal and undercooked roti), and the owner kept walking into rooms without knocking. Privacy? What's that? They even displayed a sign that said the address was House No. 12, 3rd Cross, next to the temple. Honestly, I felt like I was living in a hostel, not a PG.
normalised: Then there was the P-G on eighty Feet Road, Koramangala, Pin Code five hundred and sixty double zero thirty four. The address seemed good, right? Prime location. But the reality was different. It was crammed with people, the food was consistently awful (think watery dal and undercooked roti), and the owner kept walking into rooms without knocking. Privacy? What's that? They even displayed a sign that said the address was House Number twelve, third Cross, next to the temple. Honestly, I felt like I was living in a hostel, not a P-G.

unnormalised: My advice? Go visit the place in person, no matter how tempting the photos look. Check the address carefully, especially if it's a smaller lane or a by-lane. Some addresses I saw were literally just a number and a lane name, like "Lane 6, BTM Layout, 560076," with no building number or anything. Good luck finding that in Bangalore traffic!
normalised: My advice? Go visit the place in person, no matter how tempting the photos look. Check the address carefully, especially if it's a smaller lane or a by-lane. Some addresses I saw were literally just a number and a lane name, like "Lane six, B-T-M Layout, five hundred and sixty double zero seventy six," with no building number or anything. Good luck finding that in Bangalore traffic!

unnormalised: Also, talk to current residents. Ask them about the food, the cleanliness, the security, and the overall vibe. A chat with someone living at "Flat 201, Sai Residency, Marathahalli, 560037" can give you way more reliable information than any brochure. Don't be afraid to be nosy! It's your money, and your sanity, on the line.
normalised: Also, talk to current residents. Ask them about the food, the cleanliness, the security, and the overall vibe. A chat with someone living at "Flat two hundred and one, Sai Residency, Marathahalli, five hundred and sixty double zero thirty seven" can give you way more reliable information than any brochure. unnormalised: Finally, double-check the contract. Make sure the rent, security deposit (usually 2 months' rent), and included amenities are clearly stated. One PG I looked at in Electronic City, Phase 1, with the address "Plot No. 4, Near Wipro Gate, 560100," had a clause in the contract that said they could increase the rent without prior notice. No way, Jose!

unnormalised: Finding a decent PG in Bangalore is like finding a needle in a haystack, but with a bit of research and a healthy dose of skepticism, you'll eventually find a place that feels like home (or at least, close enough to it). Good luck with your search!
normalised: Finding a decent P-G in Bangalore is like finding a needle in a haystack, but with a bit of research and a healthy dose of skepticism, you'll eventually find a place that feels like home (or at least, close enough to it). Good luck with your search!

unnormalised: Remember to always verify the exact address before signing anything. Places sometimes omit key details like apartment number or floor on their online listings. Something like "#304, 2nd Floor, Prestige Apartments, Bellandur, 560103" is much clearer than just the apartment name and area.
